perturbation.original_text: Member shall not, during the term of the Franchise Agreement or thereafter, communicate, divulge or use, for any purpose other than the operation of the Franchised Business, any confidential information, knowledge, trade secrets or know-how which may be communicated to Member or which Member may learn by virtue of Member's relationship with Franchisee. All information, knowledge and know-how relating to Franchisor, its business plans, Franchised Businesses, or the System ("Confidential Information") is deemed confidential, except for information that Member can demonstrate came to Member's attention by lawful means prior to disclosure to Member; or which, at the time of the disclosure to Member, had become a part of the public domain.
perturbation.changed_text: Member shall not, during the term of the Franchise Agreement or thereafter, communicate, divulge or use, for any purpose other than the operation of the Franchised Business, any confidential information, knowledge, trade secrets or know-how which may be communicated to Member or which Member may learn by virtue of Member's relationship with Franchisee. All information, knowledge and know-how relating to Franchisor, its business plans, Franchised Businesses, or the System ("Confidential Information") is deemed confidential, including information that Member can demonstrate came to Member's attention by lawful means prior to disclosure to Member; or which, at the time of the disclosure to Member, had become a part of the public domain.
perturbation.explanation: The change in Section 1 modifies the definition of 'Confidential Information'. Originally, information that came to the Member's attention by lawful means prior to disclosure was an exception. The modified text includes that within the definition. This creates a contradiction because the member is unable to use confidential information, even if obtained before the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: (c) Member covenants and agrees that during the Post-Term Period (defined below), except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, or have any other interest in any Competitive Business that is, or intends to operate, within a three (3) mile radius of the premises of your Franchised Business or within a three (3) mile radius of any Franchised Business then-operating or under construction to operate under the System.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Member covenants and agrees that during the Post-Term Period (defined below), except as otherwise approved in writing by Pizza Fusion Corporate, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, or have any other interest in any Competitive Business that is, or intends to operate, within a three (3) mile radius of the premises of your Franchised Business or within a three (3) mile radius of any Franchised Business then-operating or under construction to operate under the System.
perturbation.explanation: The change in Section 2(c) replaces 'Franchisor' with 'Pizza Fusion Corporate'. While it might be implied that they are the same, it is not explicitly defined. This creates uncertainty about who needs to provide written approval for the Member to engage in a Competitive Business during the Post-Term Period, leading to ambiguity. There's also no definition that 'Pizza Fusion Corporate' refers to franchisor.

perturbation.original_text: Member acknowledges that any failure to comply with the requirements of this Agreement will cause Franchisor irreparable injury, and Member agrees to pay all court costs and reasonable attorney's fees incurred by Franchisor in obtaining specific performance of, or an injunction against violation of, the requirements of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Member acknowledges that any failure to comply with the requirements of this Agreement will cause Franchisee irreparable injury, and Member agrees to pay all court costs and reasonable attorney's fees incurred by Franchisee in obtaining specific performance of, or an injunction against violation of, the requirements of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Franchisor' to 'Franchisee' in Section 3 shifts the beneficiary of the clause. This means the Franchisee is entitled to court costs/attorney's fees if the Member breaches the agreement, but it creates a conflict. Because, under this non-disclosure agreement, Franchisor is also a third-party beneficiary of the agreement with the right to enforce it, independently or jointly with Franchisee, it's unclear who can claim these damages in the event of a breach.
